Tactical rules that aim to create all the chaos and mayhem of a galley clash from boarding actions to small arms fire.

Combat card system that brings immense playability to each game - with over 40 Combat Cards - you will never play the same battle again.

Features over 8 + scenarios from Mediterannean and Indian Oceans

The game comes with a easy index rulebook with charts that cover for ramming and naval gun attacks, fanaticism,  traversing coastal water.

The complexity level is Simple to Medium (with optional special rules scales up to medium+detailed)

The game introduces an "Activation by Wing Marker" pull system to the OB mechanism that randomizes the fire and movement but simplifies the routine chores and allows much faster gameplay.

Name: On the Square
Description:
To begin players, choose which of the Lodge Officers they wish to play as, Inner Guard, Junior Warden, Senior Warden or Director of Ceremonies? All Officers are equal and enter the Lodge, at The Tyler’s Step, in the 1st degree. Linear Progress around the lodge is achieved by dice roll (D12), Using the "On The Square" step Officers may choose to enter the checker Board and take a more direct route. To aid progress through the lodge, Officers collect Gavels (An important Freemasonry device). These can be used to change the result of a dice roll by 1 step each - 1 more or 1 less, up to 3 Gavels can be used each turn, but Officers must have 3 Gavels at the end of the game.

Officers also collect the Tools of each degree, 3 in each degree. Completing a Toolset allows Officers to progress to higher or lower degrees throughout the game. Officers also need to sit in each of the Principal Officers seats, in turn: Inner Guard, Junior Deacon, Senior Deacon, Junior Warden, Senior Warden & Worshipful Master. Achieving each seat also creates more opportunities to move between degrees. Landing on the Worshipful Master at any time also allows for movement between the 3 degrees. Throughout the Officers journey around the Lodge, there are several steps which provide additional help, or sometimes hindrances to progress. The Secretaries, Charity Stewards and Treasures issue summonses, by way of card selection. All of which must be obeyed. Grand Lodge also offers advice by card selection which must be obeyed.

Special moves: During gameplay, landing on the Junior or Senior Deacons steps allows officers to swap corners, from one step to the other. Landing on the Immediate Past Master step (IPM) Officers, not on the step are able to double their collections of Gavels or Tools while the IPM step is occupied. As a thank, you for the IPM's help, the officer on this step can forgo their dice roll and choose any step to Progress to instead. Land on either of the Visitors steps and officers can get further instruction by rolling the Visitors dice (D20) and referring to the Visitors book for the corresponding instruction. When landing "on the Square" Officers can elect (Before rolling the dice) to enter the checkerboard and move directly towards any step they wish. There is also an opportunity to aid a Candidate throughout their journey if an Officer lands on the Candidate step, you collect your Candidate and each of your dice rolls can be repeated with your Candidates steps. You lose your Candidate when passing the Tyler step. Combining "On The Square" with a Candidate allows you to potentially keep your Candidate much longer.

When an Officer has progressed through each degree, collected all 9 tools and has sat in each Officer's seat, collecting all 6 along with having a minimum of 3 gavels, that Officer can win the game by being the first to sit in their own seat. They can then win the game and claim to be Master of their Lodge.

Name: POINTREE
Description:
Your task during the game is to set the value of dice on individual elements of the tree so as to fill them with life energy. At the beginning of each turn one player rolls 6 dice and all players set them in selected places. Energy can be set from the roots of the tree to the top, always maintaining continuous At the end of each turn, the player decides which scoring method he chooses from among the 6 possible. He can score a given color, the lowest or highest value or the ones he has completed in the designated fields. The game ends after 6 turns and the player with the highest number of points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Starmada: Full Thrust
Description:
Starmada: Full Thrust is a supplement for the Universal Game of Starship Combat providing background and ship designs for four separate factions, each taken from Ground Zero Games excellent line of Full Thrust miniatures. Over 75 individual ship classes are covered, from tiny corvettes to massive superdreadnoughts!

This book includes all of the optional rules, weapons, and systems needed to replicate space combat in the Full Thrust universe. In addition, players may choose from two alternate movement systems to create the type of game they want to play.

Finally, simplified construction rules are provided which will allow you to build your own starships to face off against those already in the book. Best of all, the ship designs within these pages are fully compatible with—and balanced against—ships from other Starmada settings without any further modification or adjustment.

A copy of the the Starmada Unity Rulebook is recommended but at a minimum the Free demo rules are needed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flash! News
Description:
This is an elaborately accessorized 1937 newspaper game. Players compete to fill a blank front page with articles, matching headlines and pictures. The box is filled with glossy paper slips marked with a category on the back and either a headline or story on the front. The stories are actual news events from the time (including some false versions).

In turn, a player rolls 2D6, which requires drawing the top slip of paper from the appropriate box. These boxes are: 2 - Must (a story that must be included); 3 - Hold for Release (a story that cannot be put on the page until released by another event; 4 - City Editor; 5 - Telegraph Editor; 6 - News Editor (allows drawing a headline or a A-sized short story); 7 - Take a C-Short story; 8 - Take a B-Short story; 9 - Copy Desk (also allows choosing a headline or an A-Short; 10 - Picture Editor; 11 - Scoop; 12 - Flash. The last two are the only ways to get "Special" stories.

Players may rearrange their pages at any time, and "Go to Press" as soon as their pages are full. When all but one player has gone to press, the remaining player follows a process to fill in the page immediately.

The articles on each page are then rated against a secret key of circulation values. These values are added up for each player, and the one with the highest total circulation wins.

—user summary

Name: Armada Game of Naval Warfare
Description:
This is a chess-type game of modern naval warfare published in the Philippines in 1975. The board has an unusual circular shape divided into latitudes and longtitudes.

Each player starts with 18 plastic ships in green or grey: 1 aircraft carrier, 1 battleship, 2 each of cruisers, destroyers and submarines, 4 mine ships and six patrol ships. Each type of ship has a unique "command" pattern that defines the directions and distances to which it can move and attack.

Before starting, each player secretly designates either his battleship or his aircraft carrier as his "flagship". The game ends immediately if a player takes the opposing flagship.

The game may also end in a truce: either because neither player has enough forces left to capture the opposing flagship or because one is offered by one player. If the opposing player refuses the truce offer, he must win within 14 moves or the truce becomes automatic. The winner of a game ending in a truce is determined by the point values of opposing ships captured, between 1 and 5 each.

—user summary

Name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Pozostawione Wskazówki
Description:
When the investigation stops, the investigators decide to find additional clues that may have remained at home even years after the crime. Seeing their efforts, the Spirit decides to send dreams about the place where the answers to their questions are found. This mini add-on introduces cards of left clues that gently modify the gameplay.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Age of Ulysses
Description:
Beyond the horizon to the West. Find the golden fruit. A port of peace and happiness.

This is not the dawn of the mythical age.

Our stage is the 13th century. Europe’s marine navigation technology was developing. The East Indian route was still outside reach, nevermind the route through the Gibralter Straight in the direction of England-France.

The pioneering development of this route came by the fleet of Genoa, a rapidly evolving city. The merchant vessels that sailed from the Republic did not head west immediately, but rather swung left from the Straight of Messina, striking the Aegean Sea, the Black Sea, and the Eastern Mediterranean. They buy spices and dying agents from Islamic merchants, and then bring them to the Flanders to make a profit: beautiful Flemish textiles.

There are no dazzling golden sheep and no exciting battles with monsters, but in search of “the wealth that is right there,” the traders pursued their dream of adventure through  grueling voyages.

You are responsible for either the prestigious Spinola family or the Doria family, and aim for economic development of the family through maritime trade. There are 10 harbors beyond Naples, Antioch and Barcelona. Keep your fleet intact, rich in cargo to gain rights of trade at ports of call.

The opponent is not only the enemy. Local merchants are also rivals. Align your ship’s progress with the shifting importance of the regions and deliver trade goods and victory to Bruges.

Using a regular deck of cards, some cubes, and a couple simple boards, players will use hand management and fortunate draws to outpace their opponent's trade.

Name: Biznelis
Description:
Biznelis is a game of entrepreneurship and business management. Biznelis has been designed with the intention of breaking some clichés: victory does not depend on luck, there does not need to be only one winner, victory is not for those who have more money.
The game focuses on the growth and solidification phase of the business model that each player creates. Players start with a vague company and have to make decisions that will shape the company and that ultimately involve the development of their entrepreneurial spirit. In this decision-making, subject to restrictions and limitations of resources, the financing, financial sustainability and profitability of the company are involved. The game includes concepts typical of today's society such as the social economy, the collaborative economy, the circular economy and the digital economy.
Once the game is over, the companies of each player will be valued according to the number and suitability of customers who have managed to retain loyalty.

—description from the designer

Name: The Quest Kids: The Trials of Tolk the Wise
Description:
The Trials of Tolk the Wise is a story driven campaign for The Quest Kids board game. It is an introduction fantasy campaign experience for young heroes 5 years old and up.

In The Trials of Tolk the Wise a mysterious note found at the bottom of an ancient treasure chest sends The Quest Kids on an exciting adventure inside the magical cave of Tolk the Wise.

There are five unique quests included in the campaign that tell an ongoing story and introduce new game mechanics to young players.

During the campaign The Quest Kids will:

Solve mysterious puzzles
Make impactful, story driven choices
Discover new friends with special powers
Unlock unique hero abilities
Open sealed envelopes
Face off against new bad guys

Please note: The Quest Kids base game is REQUIRED to play The Trials of Tolk the Wise Adventure Campaign.

The Trials of Tolk the Wise was included in all original pledges from the initial Kickstarter run in September 2019 but will be sold separate from The Quest Kids base game once the game is shipped later in the summer of 2020.

Name: Threat Level: Tube Strike
Description:
This is a 2d6 narrative solo wargame based on the modern (2010 - Present) British Police forces battle against terror.

You play as the police force as they battle terrorists in different missions with more missions on the way, the game as an AI system to include members of the public, profiles and terrorists.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Innsmouth Conspiracy: Expansion
Description:
Not far from Arkham, the stooped and weathered town of Innsmouth squats on the Atlantic coast. An aura of decrepitude and decay hangs over the city like the ocean fog, from the weirdly glowing windows of the Gilman House to the deserted and toppling Fish Street bridge. Beyond the city limits, the Innsmouth shoreline is pocked with half-flooded tidal tunnels and unnatural coves. Who knows what strange, abyssal trinkets you might find, among the skeletons of fish and rotting seaweed?

The Innsmouth Conspiracy, the sixth deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, invites you to take your first steps in a twisting, time-jumping tale, starting with the campaign’s first two scenarios included in this expansion. From the heart of Innsmouth itself to the torturous coastline and beyond, these scenarios tee up an adventure that will continue to unfold across the subsequent six Mythos Packs. Far from including just two new scenarios, however, The Innsmouth Conspiracy brings five new investigators to the table with an undersea trove of player cards to support new types of decks—along with new mechanics for players to sink their teeth into, including keys, flood tokens, bless tokens, and curse tokens!

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Innsmouth Conspiracy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Konik Morrski
Description:
Konik Morrski is a game based on the history of the 2M3D RPG campaign, which MichaÅ‚ "Baniak" BaÅ„ka ran on his channel for years.

Konik Morrski is a card game consisting of 26 pairs and two single cards. We give players all the cards. They cannot change their order. On his turn, the player can place a pair in front of him and activate it. Then he draws one card from another player and if he has completed another pair, he can also put it out and activate it. At activation, each pair provides a special skill and provides victory points at the end of the game.

The game ends when there are fewer cards left in the hands than the number of players. If there is someone left with the Konik Morrski card, that player automatically loses without counting points.

The player with the most points wins.

Name: Rising Sun: Promo 1 – Sacred Warrior, Phoenix, and Nure-Onna
Description:
Set of 3 monster miniatures for Rising Sun:
Sacred Warrior - panda. Has +1 force for each Virtue card you have.
Phoenix - If Phoenix is killed, gain VP and return it to the same Province immediately.
Nure-Onna - Counts as 2 Force. Before resolving War in a Province, this may cross a Shipping Route to join that Battle.

Note: These monsters were included as stretch goals for the original Kickstarter campaign.

Name: A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked – Dark Revelations Game Supplement
Description:
The Dark Revelations Supplement is a Web-exclusive for 'A Touch of Evil' and features 15 new game cards to expand on Card Decks from the A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion.  You must have a copy of the Something Wicked Expansion to use these new cards.

The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature all new artwork.

Name: Symbiosis
Description:
How well do you know animals?

The world is full of amazing wonders. The animal kingdom is one of them, just waiting to be discovered by you.

Symbiosis is a game to help you learn about exotic animals in an entertaining way. Compete using fascinating animal cards, play awesome human powers, and collect habitats to win!

This game was designed for people who wish to know more about animals, because knowing them will allow you to care for them and ultimately cooperate with them in a symbiotic way.

HOW IT WORKS

To win you have to collect 4 different habitats or 3 of the same before everyone else. There are 6 different types of habitats. To gain habitats you have to compete for them using animal cards. There are 120 different animals, 20 for each habitat

Animals have four different characteristics: speed, length, lifespan, and birth rate. Each habitat is won with a different characteristic.

But wait! There are also powerful humans, who have game changing abilities that can utterly obliterate your opponent's schemes!

Name: Tractus Bellica: Space Fleet Combat Rules
Description:
TRACTUS BELLICA is a set of easy to play open genre sci-fi space fleet combat rules.   
All of the classic elements of spaceship to spaceship combats in the scif-fi universe are taken into account. Game play is both easy and quick. 
The rules can be played with miniatures or counters on either an open tabletop or on hexes. 
The rules use a D6 combat system and an initiative based phased Igo-Ugo format. 
Statistics for more then 30 ship classes and installations, including rules for fighters. 
Additional rules cover space monsters and abstract ground combat.
 The rules are designed for those who are looking for just the right mix of flavor and content, without too much complication.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warsaw is Burning: The Polish Campaign
Description:
Warsaw is burning! is the first supplement for Five Men at Kursk.

Offering a new way of doing wargame campaigns, rather than giving you a few prepackaged scenarios, Kursk relies on random tables to generate a potentially infinite amount of scenarios.

The expansion provides the tables to roll up Polish, German and Soviet squads along with their respective support tables, custom-tailored to September 1939.
Tank profiles include vehicles like the 7TP and 20mm armed tankettes.
Included are also special rules to add additional flavour, new terrain and mission objective tables suitable for a campaign game and notes for continuing your campaign into WW2.

Intended for use with Five Men at Kursk, the expansion can also be adapted to most any skirmish wargame

—description from the publisher

Name: On Samhain's Eve: Fantasy Skirmishes in Chevauchee
Description:
A full fantasy supplement for the Chevauchee skirmish wargame rules.

On Samhain's Eve offers the following features:

     Rules for heroes, spell casting, non-human characters and mystical weapons.
     A bestiary of medieval-inspired monsters and the ability to create your own completely random monstrosities.
     3 introductory scenarios as well as a simple selection system to quickly set up a fantastic encounter.
     A new style of campaign, the Quest. Take your adventuring party and go on a perilous journey, fraught with encounters and random events. 


On Samhain's eve builds upon the fundamentals of Chevauchee, expanding the game to allow you a few mystical elements in a campaign or full blow fantasy adventures with elves, noble knights and vile demons battling it out.

This is a supplement and although much of the material could be easily adapted to other systems, to make the most of it you will need the Chevauchee core rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Company Commander in Spaaace: A Science Fiction Supplement for FiveCore Company Commander
Description:
Whether you want to lead a grav tank platoon, crush the enemy under the treads of your super tank or command a company of colonial militia against an onslaught of alien bugs, this supplement for FiveCore Company Commander has you covered.


     New unit types, ranging from grav tanks and drop troops to stealth units and super soldiers.
     Rules for super-sized units like monsters, super tanks and mecha.
     New weapons systems, including energy weapons and drone swarms.
     New unit specialists to assist your squads, like psionics and sentry guns.
     To round it all off, a new war generator to help set up a science fiction conflict.


A typical army has 8-15 stands. Suitable for scales from 6-15mm but playable in other scales.

This is a supplement and a copy of FiveCore Company Commander is required to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hop la bille: Bille Chaude Promo Card
Description:
Promo Card for the Game Hop la bille. Included with magazine Plato n°61 from November 2013.
In deviation to the other cards, this 'Bille chaude'-Card is not placed on the solved cards pile after the combination has been set up, but the next player receives it and must also fulfill the combination. 
The card 'Bille Chaude' is never fulfilled but always passed on.

Name: Phalanx: Fast table-top gaming with model soldiers, dice and rules covering the period 3000 BC to 1500 AD
Description:
The most unique ancient wargame set ever produced. Featuring revolutionary game mechanisms from the top down. Featuring combat resolution by one die. Fast, quick with realistic results to boot. Download the best ancients game ever. All yours for no charge whatsoever.

—description from the publisher
